channel.title: Runtime on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Runtime on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: security: Running OpenClaw safely: identity, isolation, and runtime risk
item.description:
Microsoft Security Blog outlines risks of self-hosted agent runtimes (like OpenClaw) that execute untrusted input while holding long-lived credentials, creating compounded supply-chain exposure. It emphasizes governance plus identity controls and runtime isolation to reduce credential and execution risk in enterprise deployments.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure Functions .NET 10 support
item.description:
Azure Functions now generally supports .NET 10 for production workloads, allowing function apps to run on the latest .NET runtime.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: .NET 11 Preview 1 is now available!
item.description:
.NET 11 Preview 1 is available as the first preview release of .NET 11.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Announcing .NET 10 Release Candidate 2
item.description:
Microsoft announced .NET 10 Release Candidate 2, emphasizing final quality, reliability, and stabilization across the runtime, SDK, libraries, ASP.NET Core, Blazor, .NET MAUI, and related components.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: ai: Foundry Local Meets More Silicon
item.description:
Foundry Local is a high-performance local AI runtime from Azure AI Foundry that brings model execution and hardware acceleration to client devices. It enables developers to build and ship cross-platform AI apps that run accelerated models on a wide range of silicon.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: dotnet: Performance Improvements in .NET 10
item.description:
A blog post announcing and summarizing hundreds of performance improvements in .NET 10, offering a guided tour of enhancements across the platform to make apps faster, more memory-efficient, and more responsive.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Announcing .NET 10 Release Candidate 1
item.description:
.NET 10 Release Candidate 1 is now available, bringing improvements across the runtime, SDK, libraries, ASP.NET Core, Blazor, .NET MAUI, and more.

  • Source: .NET
